<! [CDATA[
Molson Coors Logo The Molson Coors Beverage Company is a multinational brewing company, formed in 2005 by the merger of Molson of Canada, and Coors of the United States. It is the world’s seventh largest brewer by volume. While the company is incorporated in the United States, it is traded on stock exchanges in both the United States and Canada, and control is equally shared between the Molson and Coors families. The company is headquartered at 1801 California Street, a 1,372,179-square-foot (127,479.
You can download the Molson Coors logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Molson Coors
item.description: The Molson Coors Beverage Company is a multinational brewing company, formed in 2005 by the merger of Molson of Canada, and Coors of the United States. It is the world’s seventh largest brewer by volume. While the company is incorporated in the United States, it is traded on stock exchanges in both the United States and Canada, and control is equally shared between the Molson and Coors families. The company is headquartered at 1801 California Street, a 1,372,179-square-foot (127,479.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Asahi Breweries Logo Asahi Group Holdings, Ltd. is a global beer, spirits, soft drinks and food business group headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. In 2018, the group had a revenue JPY 2.1 trillion. Asahi’s revenue can be segmented as follows: alcoholic beverage business (41.3%), overseas business (32%), soft drinks business (16.6%), food business (5.2%) and “other” business (4.9%). Asahi, with a 37% market share, is the largest of the four major beer brewers in Japan followed by Kirin Beer with 34% and Suntory with 16%.
You can download the Asahi logo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Asahi
item.description: Asahi Group Holdings, Ltd. is a global beer, spirits, soft drinks and food business group headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. In 2018, the group had a revenue JPY 2.1 trillion. Asahi’s revenue can be segmented as follows: alcoholic beverage business (41.3%), overseas business (32%), soft drinks business (16.6%), food business (5.2%) and “other” business (4.9%). Asahi, with a 37% market share, is the largest of the four major beer brewers in Japan followed by Kirin Beer with 34% and Suntory with 16%.

Kirin Company Logo Kirin Company, Limited is an integrated beverages company. It is a subsidiary of Kirin Holdings Company, Limited. Its major operating units include Kirin Brewery Company, Limited, Mercian Corporation and Kirin Beverages Company, Limited. Kirin is a member of the Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) keiretsu. Source

Diageo Logo Diageo plc is a British multinational alcoholic beverages company, with its headquarters in London, England and offices on six continents. It was the world’s largest distiller until being overtaken by China’s Kweichow Moutai on 9 April 2017. Source
You can download the Diageo logo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Guinness Logo
Guinness is a dark Irish dry stout that originated in the brewery of Arthur Guinness at St. James’s Gate, Dublin, Ireland, in 1759. It is one of the most successful beer brands worldwide, brewed in almost 50 countries, and available in over 120. Sales in 2011 amounted to 850 million litres (220,000,000 US gal). It is popular with the Irish, both in Ireland and abroad. In spite of declining consumption since 2001, it is still the best-selling alcoholic drink in Ireland where Guinness & Co.
You can download the Guinness logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Guinness
item.description: Guinness is a dark Irish dry stout that originated in the brewery of Arthur Guinness at St. James’s Gate, Dublin, Ireland, in 1759. It is one of the most successful beer brands worldwide, brewed in almost 50 countries, and available in over 120. Sales in 2011 amounted to 850 million litres (220,000,000 US gal). It is popular with the Irish, both in Ireland and abroad. In spite of declining consumption since 2001, it is still the best-selling alcoholic drink in Ireland where Guinness & Co.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Optimism Brewing Logo
Optimism is a brewery founded by husband and wife Troy Hakala and Gay Gilmore in 2013. It took more than a year to secure a location for the brewery and rehabilitation on the 100 year old warehouse took almost two years. Optimism is located in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle at the corner of Broadway and E Union Street (Map). The brewery opened and Optimism Brewing served Optimism Brewing first beers on December 5, 2015 (the anniversary of the Repeal of Prohibition).
You can download the Optimism Brewing logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Optimism Brewing
item.description: Optimism is a brewery founded by husband and wife Troy Hakala and Gay Gilmore in 2013. It took more than a year to secure a location for the brewery and rehabilitation on the 100 year old warehouse took almost two years. Optimism is located in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle at the corner of Broadway and E Union Street (Map). The brewery opened and Optimism Brewing served Optimism Brewing first beers on December 5, 2015 (the anniversary of the Repeal of Prohibition).

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Smirnoff Logo
Smirnoff is a brand of vodka owned and produced by the British company Diageo. The Smirnoff brand began with a vodka distillery founded in Moscow by Pyotr Arsenievich Smirnov (1831–1898). It is now distributed in 130 countries[citation needed] and produced in several countries including Albania, Brazil, Honduras, India, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Mongolia, the Philippines, the United Kingdom and the United States[citation needed]. Smirnoff products include vodka, flavoured vodka, and malt beverages.
You can download the Smirnoff logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Smirnoff
item.description: Smirnoff is a brand of vodka owned and produced by the British company Diageo. The Smirnoff brand began with a vodka distillery founded in Moscow by Pyotr Arsenievich Smirnov (1831–1898). It is now distributed in 130 countries[citation needed] and produced in several countries including Albania, Brazil, Honduras, India, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Mongolia, the Philippines, the United Kingdom and the United States[citation needed]. Smirnoff products include vodka, flavoured vodka, and malt beverages.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Budweiser Logo
Budweiser is an American-style pale lager produced by Anheuser-Busch, currently part of the transnational corporation Anheuser-Busch InBev and produced in various breweries around the world. There is an unrelated lager also called Budweiser, originating centuries ago in Budweis, Bohemia and made by Budweiser Budvar Brewery of České Budějovice, Czech Republic; this has given rise to a trademark dispute preventing Anheuser-Busch from using the “Budweiser” name in some regions, leading to the exclusive use of “Bud” in those markets.
You can download the Budweiser logo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Budweiser
item.description: Budweiser is an American-style pale lager produced by Anheuser-Busch, currently part of the transnational corporation Anheuser-Busch InBev and produced in various breweries around the world. There is an unrelated lager also called Budweiser, originating centuries ago in Budweis, Bohemia and made by Budweiser Budvar Brewery of České Budějovice, Czech Republic; this has given rise to a trademark dispute preventing Anheuser-Busch from using the “Budweiser” name in some regions, leading to the exclusive use of “Bud” in those markets.
